results.title: The Athletes [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in AUstralia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain. Narration is in the Greek language.

results.title: The Astronomers. Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Christine Z Wiser, Linda Feferman and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Waves of the future looks at the lives and methods of two theorists as they investigate gravity waves and propose extravagant experiments with gravity wave detectors, both here on earth and in space. “Stardust” looks at the life and death of stars, in particular how they are born in dark areas of the universe. “Prospecting for planets” concentrates on the explosion of discoveries made by the Voyager project, the search for other planetary systems and how planetary systems are formed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christine Z Wiser, Linda Feferman and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)

results.title: The Astronomers. Eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: David Oyster, Julio Moline, James F. Golway and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: A series which looks at the research projects of individual astronomers, and the process of astronomy. “Where is the rest of the universe?” looks at the work of three astronomers: Vera Rubin and Tony Tyson who are conducting separate research projects into dark matter, which astronomers believe makes up 90% of the known universe and Frank Dobson, inventor of a home-made telescope, who preaches the gospel of astronomy to anyone who will listen. “Searching for black holes” looks in detail at an experiment linking several radio telescopes worldwide in an attempt to discover if there is a black hole at the heart of a quasar-like galaxy NGC1275. “A Window to creation” looks at background radiation from the big bang and the attempt to explain how the smoothness of the primeval universe developed into the complex universe we now can see. Narrated by Richard Chamberlain.

results.title: The Astronaut
results.creator_credit: Peter Charley, Alan Hall, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description: In 1998 the Space Shuttle “Endeavour” left Earth with a crew of seven - six American astronauts and one Russian cosmonaut to join the aging space shuttle Mir. On board was astronaut Andy Thomas, a space engineer born in Australia who trained in Russia to prepare for the mission. His stay on Mir would be for 4 1/2 months and his main function was to be the subject of research on the psychological and physiological effects of being in space. This research was used in developing the International Space Station Program; 15 nations working together to construct a permanently occupied laboratory in space.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Charley, Alan Hall, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Beyond Productions

results.title: The Astonishing Ashtons
results.creator_credit: Lisa Jane Wallace, John Moore and John Moore Productions
results.brief_description: For 150 years Ashton’s Circus has criss-crossed Australia, battling floods, high winds and outback roads to bring the magic of the circus to rural and city dwellers alike. This documentary goes behind the greasepaint and spectacle of the circus to provide an insight into the lives of the circus performers and other personnel.

results.title: The Astonished heart
results.creator_credit: Terence Fisher, Antony Darnborough and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Noel Coward appears in this film he adapted from one of the nine one-act plays that make up the repertoire of his 1936 “Tonight at 8.30”. This repertoire included a diverse mix of song, dance and drama and was presented as a triple bill to showcase the talents of Coward and Gertrude Lawrence. This film concerns the emotional upheaval experienced by three friends who attempt to solve the problem by intellect. Psychiatrist Dr Christian Faber (Noel Coward) and his wife, Barbara (Celia Johnson) have begun to take each other for granted in their marriage. Christian begins an affair with Barbara’s best friend Leonora (Margaret Leighton). The affair is discovered by Barbara and the three avoid hurting one another over the issue. Christian is affected more deeply however, viewing his actions as a failure to meet his own moral and professional standards. Also starring Joyce Carey, Graham Payne, Amy Veness, Ralph Michael and Michael Hordern. Noel Coward also composed the musical score.

results.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Dede Gardner, Jules Daly, Ridley Scott, Brad Pitt, David Valdes, Warner Bros. Pictures, Jesse Films Inc., Alberta Film Entertainment, Scott Free Productions, Virtual Studios and Plan B Entertainment
results.headline_credit: Canada, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2007
results.brief_description: Outlaw Jesse James is rumored to be the ‘fastest gun in the West’. An eager recruit into James’ notorious gang, Robert Ford eventually grows jealous of the famed outlaw and, when Robert and his brother sense an opportunity to kill James, their murderous action elevates their target to near mythical status.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?
